title: SQLBACKUP DATABASEfor SQL Server

metadata.description: Learn about SQLBACKUP DATABASEfor SQL Server with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Introduction
content_sections.content:
SQL
BACKUP DATABASE
for SQL Server

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
The SQL BACKUP DATABASE Statement
The
BACKUP DATABASE
statement is used in SQL Server to create a full back up of an existing SQL database.
Syntax
BACKUP DATABASE
databasename
TO DISK = '
filepath
';
The SQL BACKUP WITH DIFFERENTIAL Statement
A differential back up only backs up the parts of the database that have 
changed since the last full database backup.
Syntax
BACKUP DATABASE
databasename
TO DISK = '
filepath
'
WITH 
  DIFFERENTIAL;
BACKUP DATABASE Example
The following SQL statement creates a full back up of the existing database "testDB" 
to the D disk:
Example
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak';
Tip:
Always back up the database to a different drive than the 
actual database. Then, if you get a disk crash, you will not lose your backup 
file along with the database.
BACKUP WITH DIFFERENTIAL Example
The following SQL statement creates a differential back up of the database "testDB":
Example
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak'
WITH 
  DIFFERENTIAL;
Tip:
A differential back up reduces the back up time (since only the changes are backed up).

★
+1

The correct definition of SQL
BACKUP DATABASE
for SQL Server

quiz.question: What is since only the changes?
options: used in SQL Server to create a full back up of an existing SQL database
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of since only the changes is 'backed up)'.

summary: This tutorial covers SQLBACKUP DATABASEfor SQL Server concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLBACKUP DATABASEfor SQL Server effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLBACKUP DATABASEfor SQL Server and how to apply it in your projects.
